updates.title: “What working in retail taught me about UX design”
updates.description: Before I ever mapped a user journey online, I was wrangling life‑size elephants on Oxford Street. As you do. My first career was in fashion retail, starting on the shop floor at River Island and eventually moving into visual merchandising in central London. updates.title: How is FutureBrand using AI?
updates.description: FutureBrand is a global strategy and design agency that works with clients like Mastercard, Merck and San Pellegrino. Here executive creative director Stephen McGilvray explains how they’re using AI, and how he feels about it. You can see all the articles in this series here. updates.title: Level up your design skills for 2026
updates.description: Get $200 off courses for experienced UX and product designers—AI for UX, Advanced Figma, AI Prototyping & more. Sale ends Dec 2.

updates.title: OpenAGI emerges from stealth with an AI agent that it claims crushes OpenAI and Anthropic
updates.description: A stealth artificial intelligence startup founded by an MIT researcher emerged this morning with an ambitious claim: its new AI model can control computers better than systems built by OpenAI and Anthropic — at a fraction of the cost.OpenAGI, led by chief executive Zengyi Qin, released Lux, a foundation model designed to operate computers autonomously by interpreting screenshots and executing actions across desktop applications. The San Francisco-based company says Lux achieves an 83.6 percent s

updates.title: “iPhone Pocket feels like a departure from Apple’s design beliefs”
updates.description: Apple’s latest accessory; the £220 phone sleeve, designed in collaboration with Issey Miyake, represents a change in how tech brands are innovating. While Apple and Miyake claim the product embodies Apple’s signature blend of simple aesthetics and usability, questions arise about whether the iPhone Pocket really achieves this balance. updates.title: An AI model trained on prison phone calls now looks for planned crimes in those calls
updates.description: A US telecom company trained an AI model on years of inmates’ phone and video calls and is now piloting that model to scan their calls, texts, and emails in the hope of predicting and preventing crimes.  Securus Technologies president Kevin Elder told MIT Technology Review that the company began building its AI tools in…

updates.title: design/leader: Hyperfocus’ Paul Watmough-Halim
updates.description: Paul Watmough-Halim is co-founder and digital brand director of Hyperfocus. updates.title: The Jaguar rebrand – one year on
updates.description: One year ago today, I hit publish on a story about Jaguar’s rebrand. There seemed to be an interesting strategy behind it and the visuals were unusual, so I thought it might get some attention. That it did.
